Concurrent.origin: [the power of taxation in the general and state governments is acknowledged to be " McCulloch v. Maryland , 17 U.S. 316 (1819)"]

1.definition: occurring, arising, or operating at the same time often in relationship, conjunction, association, or cooperation [the power of taxation in the general and state governments is acknowledged to be ", 17 U.S. 316 (1819)"] [a tortious act] see alsoatat

2.definition: insuring the same property to the same extent under identical terms [ fire policies]

3.definition: exercised over the same matter or area by two different authorities see alsoatat
